intro: Gnaphalium berteroanum, commonly known as the yellow everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and produces small, yellowish to golden flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its aromatic, fuzzy leaves. Its flowers are typically arranged in dense clusters and bloom during the summer months. Gnaphalium berteroanum is often used in dryland gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
